Hija de Aída Merlano dice que ella pidió sacar joyas de casa incautada y explica por qué
A través de Instagram, la joven aseguró que esos objetos no entraban entre los bienes solicitados por las autoridades y denunció supuestos atropellos.

01 Nov 2019, 09:31

Aída Victoria Merlano Manzaneda, en sus historias de la red social, dijo que ella no se había robado ninguna joyería y que tampoco  había conseguido la joyas de manera ilícita. Por eso, le pidió a su conductor sacarlas de esa casa, a la que le aplicaron la extinción de dominio, pues “se las podían robar”.
“La razón por las que yo las saqué [las joyas] de mi apartamento, con mi chofer, fue porque sabía que se iban a meter allá. Y no confío, y creo que es una posición completamente normal, en algunos funcionarios que realizan esos operativos”, aseguró la joven.
Asimismo, la hija de la prófuga exsenadora arremetió contra las autoridades por incautar sus joyas “como si se tratara de drogas, armas o de algún objeto ilícito”
“Son prendas, objetos personalísimos. Salen a hablar públicamente como si hubieran encontrado la maleta [que tenía las joyas] del ‘Chapo’ Guzmán  cosa que no es así”, dijo Merlano Manzaneda, y agregó que la Sociedad de Activos Especiales (SAE) no aceptó esos costosos objetos.
Después de que la autoridades decomisaran la maleta llena de joyas, que además tenía los pasaportes de la excongresista y un exfuncionario del Congreso con el que Merlano tenía fotos muy románticas, añadió la joven, hubo una “serie de atropellos” contra su conductor.
“A mí chofer prácticamente lo secuestraron, lo amedrantaron y lo hicieron firmar un documento; y no permitieron que se encontrara en presencia de un abogado. El abogado se tuvo que quedar afuera porque no dejaron que entrara”, aseveró.
Además, indicó que las autoridades le dijeron al hombre, que manejaba el BMW donde estaba la maleta con las joyas, que si no firmaba el supuesto documento, lo iban a judicializar.
En las historias, la hija de la excongresista, vinculada a la investigación por su fuga, manifestó que el 80 % de los bienes de Merlano fueron conseguidos “antes de que hiciera política”, pues se dedicaba a otra “actividad completamente licita”.
No obstante, cabe recordar que El Herlado dijo que la prófuga de la justicia inició su vida política a los 15 años, de la mano de la poderosa casa política Gerlein.

text:
Daughter of Aída Merlano says she asked to take jewelry from a seized house and explains why
Through Instagram, the young woman said that those objects did not enter among the goods requested by the authorities and denounced alleged abuses.

01 Nov 2019, 09:31

Aída Victoria Merlano Manzaneda, in her social network stories, said that she had not stolen any jewelry and that she had not obtained the jewelry illegally. Therefore, he asked his driver to take them out of that house, to which they applied the domain extinction, because "they could be stolen."
“The reason I took them [the jewels] from my apartment, with my driver, was because I knew they were going to get in there. And I don't trust, and I think it's a completely normal position, in some officials who carry out these operations, ”said the young woman.
Likewise, the daughter of the former fugitive lashed out at the authorities for seizing her jewels "as if they were drugs, weapons or some illegal object"
“They are garments, very personal objects. They go out to speak publicly as if they had found the suitcase [which had the jewels] of ‘Chapo’ Guzmán, which is not the case, ”said Merlano Manzaneda, adding that the Society of Special Assets (SAE) did not accept those expensive objects.
After the authorities seized the suitcase full of jewels, which also had the passports of the former congressman and a former congressman with whom Merlano had very romantic photos, the young woman added, there was a "series of abuses" against his driver.
“They practically kidnapped my driver, intimidated him and made him sign a document; and they did not allow him to be in the presence of a lawyer. The lawyer had to stay outside because they didn't let him in, ”he said.
In addition, he indicated that the authorities told the man, who was driving the BMW where the suitcase was with the jewels, that if he did not sign the supposed document, they would prosecute him.
In the stories, the ex-congresswoman's daughter, linked to the investigation for her escape, said that 80% of Merlano's assets were obtained “before she did politics,” since she was engaged in another “completely lawful activity”.
However, it should be remembered that El Herlado said that the fugitive from justice began her political life at age 15, at the hands of the powerful Gerlein political house.
